Package com.intellij.openapi.ui.popup

Interface JBPopup

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Disposable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ListPopup, TreePopup
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractPopup, AsyncPopupImpl, BranchActionGroupPopup, BranchLogSpeedSearchPopup, ComboBoxPopup, FlatSpeedSearchPopup, ListPopupImpl, MockConfirmation, PopupFactoryImpl.ActionGroupPopup, TreePopupImpl, WizardPopup

    public interface JBPopup
extends Disposable
    Base interface for popup windows.
    See Also:
    JBPopupFactory

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.intellij.openapi.Disposable

      • showInBestPositionFor

        void showInBestPositionFor(DataContext dataContext)
        Shows the popup in the position most appropriate for the specified data context.
        Parameters:
        dataContext - the data context to which the popup is related.
        See Also:
        JBPopupFactory.guessBestPopupLocation(DataContext), getBestPositionFor(DataContext)

      • showInBestPositionFor

        void showInBestPositionFor(Editor editor)
        Shows the popup near the cursor location in the specified editor.
        Parameters:

        See Also:
        JBPopupFactory.guessBestPopupLocation(Editor)

      • closeOk

        void closeOk(java.awt.event.InputEvent e)
        Hides popup as if Enter was pressed or or any other "accept" action.

      • cancel

        void cancel()
        Cancels the popup as if Esc was pressed or any other "cancel" action.

      • setRequestFocus

        void setRequestFocus(boolean b)
        Parameters:
        b - true if popup should request focus.

      • cancel

        void cancel(java.awt.event.InputEvent e)
        Cancels the popup as a response to some mouse action. All the subsequent mouse events originated from the event's point will be consumed.

      • canClose

        boolean canClose()
        Checks if it's currently allowed to close the popup.
        Returns:
        true if the popup can be closed, false if a callback disallowed closing the popup.
        See Also:
        ComponentPopupBuilder.setCancelCallback(com.intellij.openapi.util.Computable)

      • isVisible

        boolean isVisible()
        Checks if the popup is currently visible.
        Returns:
        true if the popup is visible, false otherwise.

      • getContent

        javax.swing.JComponent getContent()
        Returns the Swing component contained in the popup.
        Returns:
        the contents of the popup.

      • setLocation

        void setLocation(java.awt.Point screenPoint)
        Moves popup to the given point. Does nothing if popup is invisible.
        Parameters:
        screenPoint - Point to move to.

      • dispatchKeyEvent

        boolean dispatchKeyEvent(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        This callback is called when new key event from the event queue is being processed.

        The popup has a right to decide if its further processing should be continued (method return value).

        Parameters:
        e - new key event being processed
        Returns:
        true if the event is completely dispatched, i.e. no further processing is necessary; false otherwise

      • canShow

        default boolean canShow()
        Whether it's OK to invoke one of the 'show' methods. Some implementation might prohibit it e.g. if the popup is shown already.
